ygData.subject: Re: [neat] NEAT with Pruning Phase : Positive result
ygData.msgSnippet: Colin, Nice to hear you re getting good results. Would you mind reminding me what your representation is? 1) What is your training/evaluation set?  ACSII?

Colin,

Nice to hear you're getting good results.

Would you mind reminding me what your representation is?

1) What is your training/evaluation set?  ACSII?  gifs?  What size?

2) How are these input into the network?

3) What are the outputs of the network?  Do you have 26 outputs, one
for each letter?

Sorry if you've covered this a while back.

I ask because we're in the process of experimenting with OCR as well. 
We're using 50x50 tiffs, 8 images of each letter, consisting of 3
different fonts (Courier, New Times Roman, and Ariel).

Thanks,
Derek

On Sat, 31 Jul 2004 21:31:45 +0100, Colin Green <cgreen@...> wrote:
> Just a quick note to say that I got the pruning phase stuff working
> yesterday and initial results look good. The OCR experiment without
> pruning usually topped out at about 10 out of 26 characters (best result
> seen was 16/26 I think). With pruning switched on I see searches
> consistently attaining 20/26 with a current best of 24/26.
> 
> Obviously a lot more details to come on this one.
